meanings.definition: A person or group that preempts something.
meanings.sent1: The preemptors arrived early to secure the best seats for the concert.
meanings.sent2: The preemptors in the company always make decisions quickly.
meanings.sent3: The preemptors at the party brought their own snacks, just in case.
meanings.sent4: She was like a preemptor in the game, always one step ahead of everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The preemptors in the race sprinted ahead with determination.

meanings.definition: The act of preempting or taking action before someone else can.
meanings.sent1: His preemptors in negotiations often gave him an advantage.
meanings.sent2: The preemptors of the team ensured they were always prepared.
meanings.sent3: The preemptors of the group decided to start the project early.
meanings.sent4: The preemptors of nature could be seen in the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The preemptors of the plan led to its success.
